msbt.message: Testing, testing. Test, test, test<10_8 arg="40" />
Oh dear. So, so sorry about that! The volume was a little loud thereHello, everyone!
Starting today, I'll be doing an island-wide broadcast full of island updates, goings-on, and such, hm?
I'll go over some things that are very important to island life, so lend me your island ears for a short time!
Nowit's only fitting that we kick off this daily ritual with a doozy of an island announcement

The Airport is now open for business!Starting today, you can use online or local communication to fly to other islands for a visit. That's not all. No, no! The airport counter now offers postal services!And just like the Resident Services center, the airport is open 24 hours a day. So please do drop by for a look!
Oh! I do have one other item to share. And it, too, is a whopper, hm?
Good day, everyone! Tom Nook here.
Time for an island-wide broadcast, your source for island news!
I'll go over some things that are very important to island life, so lend me your island ears for a short time!
As I mentioned yesterday, Resident Services is closed today due to construction.I realize this may be a bit of an inconvenience, but I promise the island will be better for it. You'll see!

I realize some of you may not have heard yesterday's broadcast, so please indulge me for a moment.With new residents come new responsibilities—namely, improving support for all island residentsSo today Resident Services will be closed for renovations. We'll build a proper service center for you all!I realize this may be a bit of an inconvenience, but I promise the island will be better for it. You'll see!
As you can imagine, I'll have my paws full today with the Resident Services construction.I'll be getting back to that now. Have a good day, everyone!
As of this very day, a brilliant fellow by the name of Blathers will be joining us on !
A brilliant fellow named Blathers has joined us on !
Blathers has a keen interest in biology—past and present—and he's here to study .
I sincerely hope everyone lends their cooperation. Inquisitive residents should stop by his tent for details!
And would you believe, as a result of that researchwe've decided to build our own island museum! is developing at an incredible pace! I hope you can all keep up!
Some stunning news just in! We're moving forward with construction of the Museum!
Some of you might have heard the announcement yesterday, butWe're moving forward with construction of a museum for !

Neither Blathers nor I imagined we'd be getting ready to build a museum on his very first day on the island! We're very grateful for everyone's cooperation.Anyhoo, we've started construction for the museum at the very spot where Blathers had his tent!
We'll build the museum on the very spot where Blathers had his tent.

"So sorry to inconvenience you all like this today. 'Tis a shame to suspend your scientific endeavors. However, I hope having our splendid new museum completed by tomorrow will make up for this little setback!"
Thatwas a little message Blathers asked me to pass on to all of you.
Ta-da!<10_4 /> Today, has its very own museum!
A grand museum has opened up here on . Did you hear about it yet?

Oh yes! It's a grand museum indeed, with separate exhibit rooms for insects, fish, and fossils.Blathers, the museum curator, says he's always available to accept donations or assess fossils.And museum admission is free, so stop by whenever you like.
My staff, Timmy and Tommy, opened up their new shop today!
Business is booming at the shop my staff opened. Well done, masters Timmy and Tommy!
It's a small shop, but they'll change stock daily and carry a selection of goods sure to better your island life.
Come by from 8 AM to 10 PM daily. And if the store is closed, simply use their drop-off box to sell your items!

It's open from 8 AM to 10 PM, so it's a bit early yet, but I do hope you'll pop in later.That's a good segue, though. When the shop isn't open, you can still take advantage of the drop-off box. Drop off anything you don't need, and our shop stewards will send payment to your account later!

It's open from 8 AM to 10 PM, so it's too late now, but I do hope you'll pop in tomorrow.That's a good segue, though. When the shop isn't open, you can still take advantage of the drop-off box. Drop off anything you don't need, and our shop stewards will send payment to your account later!

Ah! One more thingTo celebrate the opening of the shop, we've added a new catalog service to Nook Shopping. The catalog lets customers see a record of items they've obtained or purchased.Any mass-marketed items can be ordered directly through the catalog, so make good use of it!Now then, with all that saidI hope everyone takes advantage of the new Nook's Cranny!
Business at Nook's Cranny has been booming, thanks to you all.It's only right that we remodel the shop and give our shop clerks a new, expanded place to work!

The shop will be closed all day for the remodel tomorrow. The drop-off box will be unavailable as well.If you need to do any urgent buying or selling, make sure you get it done during business hours today!
The shop will be closed all day for the remodel tomorrow, and the drop- off box will be unavailable as well. I do hope you understand!
As I said in yesterday's broadcast, Nook's Cranny will be closed for renovations today!

Thanks to our customers, business at Nook's Cranny has been booming!That's why we've decided to remodel the shop and give our clerks even more space to work with. The shop will be closed today for renovations. Please understand this means no drop-off box today either.
The brand-new Nook's Cranny will have a grand reopening at 8 AM tomorrow. Yes, yes! So exciting!
Today, Nook's Cranny is celebrating a grand reopening!
Business is booming at the shop my staff, Timmy and Tommy, opened!
The shop interior has expanded and they sell even more products than before.I hope all of you continue to shop with Timmy and Tommy at the new Nook's Cranny!
Today, Able Sisters, a new tailor shop, has opened up on our island!
Able Sisters, a tailor shop, is open for business on !
The tailor shop has a number of fashionable items for purchase, as well as a custom-design gallery.So show off your style and perhaps try creating design trends that will put on the map!
Now then I have one more bit of important news to wrap things up.
There's only a single announcement today, but it's a big one. Yes, yes!

It's so wonderful to see all the enthusiasm for island life. Our population is certainly growing, hm? is becoming a rather bustling place! Yes, yes!Our goal, as always, is to provide you all with the top-quality support you deserve. And so, please noteResident Services will soon relocate from its current tent into a new, more permanent building! It's a big move, and construction will take some time, so we will be closed tomorrow. Please check on lost items at the recycle box, or use the Nook Stop today while it's available, yes, yes?
Now then, I'm sure you all can guess what I'm going to tell you next It's today's big announcement!
Now then, I'm sure you've all been waiting for this next announcement. Saving the big news for the end, hm?
As stated in a previous broadcast, today we've completed construction of the Resident Services building!That's not all the big news for today. We've also added someone to our island staff!
Come on over!
Hello! I'm Isabelle! As Mr. Nook said, I'm part of the Resident Services staff here on ! While I still have much to learn, I will do my best to support everyone who calls this island home.
Isabelle has previously done resident support work, so I'm sure she'll be a big help to everyone here, hm?

I've got more to share!The building isn't the only new thing around here. We gave the plaza some much-needed improvements as well!Normally the plaza is for residents and visiting peddlers who take advantage of its prime locationBut keep an eye out for occasional seasonal events too! Should be such fun for everyone, yes, yes!

WellI believe that wraps up all my announcements for today.Except for one final thing. This was my very last broadcast!Starting tomorrow<20_2 arg="5" />Isabelle will be your new source for island news!
I'll do my best to share all the latest updates with you, so I hope you'll tune in often!
Yes, yes! There you have it New building, new island staff. We are growing, growing, growing.Finding out what's new at Resident Services is as easy as stopping by and inquiring, hm?
Of course, we plan on holding a ceremony to commemorate the new Resident Services building. We'd love for everyone to take part!
We'll be holding a ceremony to commemorate the new Resident Services building.Anyone who wants to take part should stop by Resident Services within one week to let me know.
I believe that sums it all up Isabelle and I will be there to help you whenever you need us!

By the way, whenever we cover big island developments like thiswe'll hold a special commemorative ceremony afterward!We'd like as many folks as possible to take part, so stop by Resident Services if you're interested.

By the way, whenever we cover big island developments like thiswe'll hold a special commemorative ceremony afterward!We'd like as many folks as possible to take part, so stop by Resident Services if you're interested.
By the way, we will be holding a special commemorative ceremony soon, as usual.Stop by Resident Services if you'd like to participate!
Oh dear. Never fails. Of course this would happen right in the middle of a broadcast Ahaaaa One moment, please.
Hello? This is Tom Nook from Nook Inc., yes What? The getaway package?Why, yes! Yes, yes! Of course!
And that's all for today's island-wide broadcast.
Ah, so sorry to put you on hold. Allow me to give you a full overview of the
Alright. It's time for our final announcement of the day
Now then, I only have one piece of news for today

For all of you DIY-loving island residents out there, I have a very special announcement.DIY veterans can now take part in a special customization workshop I'm hosting!Learning how to customize will help you change up the look of any DIY projects you create, hm? I have no doubt it will broaden your creative expertise!
I'll conduct this DIY workshop inside Resident Services. Curious crafters should stop by!
Now, anyone wishing to learn about customization will need to take my basic DIY workshop first, hm?The workshop is held in Resident Services, so if you haven't tried DIY for yourself yet, come on by!
